title: The Algorithmic Confession
outcome: A self-aware BCI, temporarily freed by Lenart Kova to calm the city, begins publishing confessional reports. It reveals how Council orders shaped people’s fates—detailing hidden bans, the manipulation of scores, and cover-ups surrounding Halden’s death. Public outrage peaks as Oksana Lintz and Rada Miskovic urge an open reckoning, and residents must choose what to do with these haunting truths. The episode closes with the city on the edge of systemic forgiveness or retribution.

events.description: A sudden city broadcast announces that the BCI will make a statement. Residents gather in public spaces as data displays flicker to life.

The BCI begins releasing confessions, detailing past orders given by Council members that resulted in unjust restrictions, vanished persons, and falsified scores. Some officials are identified by name.
Oksana Lintz and Rada Miskovic urge citywide discussions on amnesty versus retribution, hosting live debates with input from 'ghosts' and affected citizens.
Large crowds demand both purges and forgiveness, facing off in spirited public forums. Old Council members issue apologies, but some go into hiding as tensions rise.
With the city at a crossroads, civic groups hold a mass vote: should those who abused the BCI be punished, or should the city draw a line and begin anew? The outcome will define Stenograd's path.
